subject: Climate & Environment
title: Agricultural Runoff
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Agricultural Runoff.

hook.text: Rain washes fertilizer off farm fields and into rivers. What feeds crops can kill lakes.

buildup.text: Excess nitrogen and phosphorus flow downstream, feeding algae in rivers, lakes, and coasts.

discovery.text: Algae blooms consume all the oxygen, creating dead zones where fish cannot survive.

twist.text: The Gulf of Mexico dead zone covers 6,000 square miles every summer â€” the size of Connecticut.

climax.text: Reducing runoff means changing how millions of farms apply fertilizer â€” a massive challenge.

punchline.text: What makes the land green can turn the water lifeless.
